definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: You will definitely feel hungry if you don't eat.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不喫飯的話就會餓肚子的哦。

sentences.english: Joe doesn't deprive himself of food.
sentences.chinese: 喬是不會讓自己餓肚子的。

sentences.english: In order to lose weight and let oneself hungry belly is not thin body effect.
sentences.chinese: 爲了減肥而讓自己餓肚子是沒有瘦身效果的。

sentences.english: So, although he is hungry not to eat, but I can't make the slightest concession.
sentences.chinese: 所以，儘管他餓肚子不喫飯，我卻不能做絲毫的讓步。

sentences.english: I don't diet. I don't count calories and rarely go hungry.
sentences.chinese: 我不節食，不計算食物的卡路里，也很少餓肚子。

definition: to get food at a canteen
see 驢唇不對馬嘴|驴唇不对马嘴[lu:2 chun2 bu4 dui4 ma3 zui3]
pinyin: niu2 tou2 bu4 dui4 ma3 zui3

definition: (saying) to be very scared and on edge
fried chicken pieces with salt and pepper/Taiwan-style fried chicken
lit. to turn to any doctor one can find when critically ill (idiom); fig. to try anyone or anything in a crisis
